  13. (**************************************************************************)

  15. (** Management of include directories.

  17.     This module offers a high level interface to locating files in the
  18.     load path, which is constructed from [-I] command line flags and a few
  19.     other parameters.

  21.     It makes the assumption that the contents of include directories
  22.     doesn't change during the execution of the compiler.
  23. *)

  25. ‌val add_dir : string -> unit
  26. (** Add a directory to the end of the load path (i.e. at lowest priority.) *)

  28. ‌val remove_dir : string -> unit
  29. (** Remove a directory from the load path *)

  31. ‌val reset : unit -> unit
  32. (** Remove all directories *)

  34. module Dir : sig
  35.   type t
  36.   (** Represent one directory in the load path. *)

  38.   val create : string -> t

  40.   val path : t -> string

  42.   val files : t -> string list
  43.   (** All the files in that directory. This doesn't include files in
  44.       sub-directories of this directory. *)

  46.   val find : t -> string -> string option
  47.   (** [find dir fn] returns the full path to [fn] in [dir]. *)

  49.   val find_uncap : t -> string -> string option
  50.   (** As {!find}, but search also for uncapitalized name, i.e. if name is
  51.       Foo.ml, either /path/Foo.ml or /path/foo.ml may be returned. *)
  52. end

  54. ‌type auto_include_callback =
  55.   (Dir.t -> string -> string option) -> string -> string
  56. (** The type of callback functions on for [init ~auto_include] *)

  58. ‌val no_auto_include : auto_include_callback
  59. (** No automatic directory inclusion: misses in the load path raise [Not_found]
  60.     as normal. *)

  62. ‌val init : auto_include:auto_include_callback -> string list -> unit
  63. (** [init l] is the same as [reset (); List.iter add_dir (List.rev l)] *)

  65. ‌val auto_include_otherlibs :
  66.   (string -> unit) -> auto_include_callback
  67. (** [auto_include_otherlibs alert] is a callback function to be passed to
  68.     {!Load_path.init} and automatically adds [-I +lib] to the load path after
  69.     calling [alert lib]. *)

  71. ‌val get_paths : unit -> string list
  72. (** Return the list of directories passed to [add_dir] so far. *)

  74. ‌val find : string -> string
  75. (** Locate a file in the load path. Raise [Not_found] if the file
  76.     cannot be found. This function is optimized for the case where the
  77.     filename is a basename, i.e. doesn't contain a directory
  78.     separator. *)

  80. ‌val find_uncap : string -> string
  81. (** Same as [find], but search also for uncapitalized name, i.e.  if
  82.     name is Foo.ml, allow /path/Foo.ml and /path/foo.ml to match. *)

  84. val[@deprecated] add : Dir.t -> unit
  85. (** Old name for {!append_dir} *)

  87. ‌val append_dir : Dir.t -> unit
  88. (** [append_dir d] adds [d] to the end of the load path (i.e. at lowest
  89.     priority. *)

  91. ‌val prepend_dir : Dir.t -> unit
  92. (** [prepend_dir d] adds [d] to the start of the load path (i.e. at highest
  93.     priority. *)

  95. ‌val get : unit -> Dir.t list
  96. (** Same as [get_paths ()], except that it returns a [Dir.t list]. *)
